lv.emes.libraries.gui

Class MSCustomGUIScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.gui.MSCustomGUIScreen

  • public abstract class MSCustomGUIScreen
extends java.lang.Object
    There is infinite count of different screen types that GUI can show. This class represent common attributes for them all platform independently.

    Public methods: -show -hide -close -showPreviousScreen -showNextScreen -previousScreen -nextScreen

    Protected methods: -initialize -finalize

    Properties: -onShow -onHide -onClose

    Setters and getters: -setPreviousScreen -setNextScreen

    Version:
    1.1.
    Author:
    eMeS

      static int LOGIN_SCREEN 
      static int MESSAGE_SCREEN 
      IFuncOnGUIScreenEvent onClose
      Define behavior when screen is closed for good.
      IFuncOnGUIScreenEvent onHide
      Define behavior when screen is hidden, e.g., controls shift to another screen, but this is running background.
      = (screen) -> {methods after hide()};
      IFuncOnGUIScreenEvent onShow
      Define behavior when screen shows up!
      = (screen) -> {methods after initialize(), but before show()};
      static int STANDARD_SCREEN 
      static int UNKNOWN_SCREEN 
      static int WAITING_SCREEN 
      static int WARNING_SCREEN

      • onShow

        public IFuncOnGUIScreenEvent onShow
        Define behavior when screen shows up!
        = (screen) -> {methods after initialize(), but before show()};

      • onHide

        public IFuncOnGUIScreenEvent onHide
        Define behavior when screen is hidden, e.g., controls shift to another screen, but this is running background.
        = (screen) -> {methods after hide()};

      • onClose

        public IFuncOnGUIScreenEvent onClose
        Define behavior when screen is closed for good. You can free variables here, etc.
        = (screen) -> {methods after close(), but before finalize()};

    • Constructor Detail

      • MSCustomGUIScreen

        public MSCustomGUIScreen(int type)
        Creates screen with defined type of screen. Type must be specified, to determine, which type screen is running when using this interface from many inherited classes.
        Parameters:
        type - custom type number or one of this class statically defined types. If 0 then MSCustomGUIScreen.UNKNOWN_SCREEN.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()

      • hide

        public void hide()

      • close

        public void close()

      • showPreviousScreen

        public void showPreviousScreen()
        Hides current screen and shows defined previous screen. If previous screen is null then nothing happens.

      • showNextScreen

        public void showNextScreen()
        Hides current screen and shows defined next screen. If next screen is null then nothing happens.

      • previousScreen

        public void previousScreen()
